projects.name: Post-Quantum Key Exchange Protocol
projects.short_description: Quantum-resistant KEM with 20x performance optimization via polynomial arithmetic

descriptions.crypto: Implemented NIST-compliant post-quantum KEM achieving 20x performance improvement through polynomial optimization in truncated polynomial rings, reducing complexity from O(n^4) to O(n^2)
descriptions.security: Built production-grade quantum-resistant encryption with comprehensive security testing (500+ test cases) and compliance validation against NIST PQC standardization requirements
descriptions.software: Developed high-performance C++ cryptographic library with modular architecture, extensive automated testing, and clean APIs achieving 20x throughput improvement
descriptions.applied: Research-driven implementation translating lattice cryptography theory into practical deployment, with formal complexity analysis and rigorous statistical validation across 50,000+ operations
descriptions.general: Advanced cryptographic system demonstrating strong mathematical foundations and engineering excellence, achieving 20x performance gain through algorithmic optimization

projects.name: AES Encryption Library
projects.short_description: NIST FIPS 197-compliant AES with multiple cipher modes and 2x performance optimization

descriptions.crypto: NIST FIPS 197-compliant AES implementation with 300+ test vector validations, 2x throughput improvement (250 to 500 MB/s), and statistical randomness verification at 99% confidence
descriptions.security: Production-grade encryption library validated against NIST FIPS 197 and SP 800-38A across CBC, CTR, ECB, and OFB modes, with automated security metrics and zero compliance failures
descriptions.software: Well-architected C++ library supporting multiple cipher modes with 2x performance improvement, comprehensive testing, multi-format file handling (up to 100MB, zero memory leaks), and clear documentation
descriptions.applied: Standards-based implementation demonstrating theory-to-practice translation with formal specification compliance, statistical validation framework, and metrics used in peer-reviewed research
descriptions.general: Professional-quality encryption system achieving industry standard compliance and 2x performance optimization through algorithmic analysis and cache-aware memory access patterns

projects.name: Pixel Lab â€“ Cryptanalytic Image Analysis Toolkit
projects.short_description: Python toolkit for PRNG validation using entropy, chi-square, and correlation analysis

descriptions.crypto: Statistical cryptanalysis toolkit achieving 99% accuracy in PRNG quality assessment via Shannon entropy, chi-square testing, and correlation analysis across 50,000+ operations
descriptions.security: PRNG security testing framework with automated weakness detection, successfully identifying vulnerabilities in 3 common PRNG implementations through entropy analysis and Monte Carlo validation
descriptions.software: Production-grade pip-installable Python package with 80%+ test coverage, CLI tools, and comprehensive documentation; implements pixel-level manipulation and batch processing with NumPy integration
descriptions.applied: Information-theoretic analysis toolkit bridging cryptographic theory and empirical validation, with educational examples covering PRNG testing, algorithmic art, and steganography analysis
descriptions.general: Multi-language development capability (Python) with security testing and statistical analysis, demonstrating breadth of skills beyond core cryptographic work

projects.name: Secure Communication Protocol
projects.short_description: End-to-end quantum-resistant communication scheme (Master's thesis research)

descriptions.crypto: Complete post-quantum communication protocol with rigorous mathematical foundations, security proofs under quantum threat models, and integration of NTRU-based key exchange with symmetric encryption
descriptions.security: Quantum-resistant system design for Master's thesis, addressing emerging quantum computing security threats through end-to-end protocol engineering and formal security analysis
descriptions.software: Modular communication system architecture with clean separation of concerns across key exchange, encryption, and communication layers, emphasizing component reusability
descriptions.applied: Master's research combining theoretical cryptographic design and practical implementation, including formal security proofs, complexity analysis, and proof-of-concept validation
descriptions.general: Advanced graduate research demonstrating deep technical capabilities in designing and implementing novel cryptographic communication systems

projects.name: Mathematical Foundations Website
projects.short_description: Interactive cryptographic demonstrations: RSA, ECC, hash functions, and key exchange protocols

descriptions.crypto: Public-facing cryptographic education platform demonstrating RSA, ECC, and hash function concepts interactively, supporting community outreach and cryptographic literacy
descriptions.security: Educational platform showcasing hands-on security demonstrations (ECDH, ECDSA, avalanche effect visualization) that communicate complex implementation concepts to diverse audiences
descriptions.software: Full-stack web application with interactive cryptographic visualizations built in vanilla JavaScript, demonstrating front-end development proficiency alongside core systems work
descriptions.applied: Research communication platform translating advanced cryptographic theory into accessible interactive content, supporting public outreach and academic education goals
descriptions.general: Demonstrates communication skills, self-driven learning, and commitment to making complex technical concepts accessible to broad audiences
